Sentencas: This paper presents a complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) that eliminates the ambiguity of the suitability of such model when used under different design and operating conditions.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness

Sentencas: The Butler-Volmer equation is used in the model to describe the activation overpotential instead of using simplified expressions such as the Tafel equation and the linear current-potential equation.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness

Sentencas: In the concentration overpotential, both ordinary and Knudsen diffusions are considered to cater for different porous electrode designs.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness

Sentencas: Sensitivity tests are then conducted to show the effect of the thickness of the respective fuel cell components on the drop in cell voltage.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness

Sentencas: Results show that the performance of an anode-supported fuel cell is superior to that using cathode as the support under elevated operating pressure in the cathode compartment.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness

Sentencas: The former can achieve an improved operating range of current density under normal atmospheric conditions.
Titulo: A complete polarization model of a solid oxide fuel cell and its sensitivity to the change of cell component thickness
